result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

**AMENDED 6/30/2022: Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

9:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chardeal J Gordon in court. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defendant does not qualify for SPD appointment.  Defendant needs more time to save money to retain counsel.
S.T., defendant's mother, speaks on behalf of defendant regarding retaining counsel, will try to help, requesting 30 days to obtain counsel.
State obj. and requests to have de novo review of bond heard today.
BTC: Set out 3 weeks.  Bond modified to include GPS/House Arrest.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits.
